website_summaries.verdict: A great first choice for adding a bar support in your bathroom. Length is more appropriate for smaller bathrooms or walk-in showers.
pros: Great bar diameter for a secure hold when showering or taking a bath
Metal finish will resist corrosion and staining while in use
cons: Limited length won’t span the entire width of a tub

customer_reviews.title: Secure Mount Anchors Not included
customer_reviews.text: This product is a Moen, so it most likely deserves a 5 Star rating. But, I took off one star because the description is very misleading. Video shows installing Secure Mount Anchors, and it also shows Secure Mount anchors right on the description page. There are NO secure mount anchors included, only hardware for STUD installation. If you need this item in a location where there is no stud, you will need to buy Moen secure mount anchors sold separately, which are around $20. I would recommend this for stud installation, please do not be deceived by advertising shown on this page.
customer_reviews.author: Mikesgirl

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend only drilling one hole at each end and putting ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked out well for having hand rails along the steps leading from our house and into the garage for my elderly parents. The long screws are extremely secure when fastened into a stud as described in the instructions. I would recommend only drilling one hole at each end and putting those two screws in first before marking and then drilling the remaining four holes, so that you can more easily align all the holes and get them screwed in properly without binding.
customer_reviews.author: C. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Screws are garbage, soft
customer_reviews.text: Handle is well made. Confirming material is stainless. Screws are garbage, soft, Philips is very shallow, rips off at low torque. Covers were made from thin gage, very easy to dimple. Functional handle though. Used 3/32 to predrill screw holes.
customer_reviews.author: Noah T

customer_reviews.title: Jacuzzi now is safe to enter & exit.
customer_reviews.text: This Grab Bar (mounted on a wood enclosed lolly column) makes my new Jacuzzi hot tub safe for us oldsters to enter and exit. Added later: For writer with thin paneling so only one end can attach to a stud, I recommend NOT BUYING this 12-inch bar. Find out distance between your wall studs. Amazon's 32-inch will be much safer. If studs are 16-inches on center, perfect. If 24-inches, angle the 32-inch grab bar so each end mount is over a stud. Solid mount is essential to safety. A falling person needs that safety.
customer_reviews.author: E. Caroe

customer_reviews.title: Well made and a must for bathroom safety. If ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and a must for bathroom safety. If you're remodeling a bathroom or building a new one, this Moen bar Can go far to avoid a fall accident. You should give the project some careful thought so you need to give it some real thought. Just remember, it's much easier to mount safety/grab bars the necessary thought and planning BEFORE you've mounted the sheet rock. This newer Moen bar is fatter than what we've used in the past and seems much more secure to hold onto.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Morganstein

customer_reviews.title: Next Stop... GRAVE! Industry Standard ADA Grab Bar.
customer_reviews.text: As a remodeling contractor, I've installed plenty of these in assisted living facilities. When my wife informed me she wanted one for the Master Bath, I thought, OK, "...it's over". The next step? Tom Selleck selling us a reverse mortgage, or Alex Trebek selling us life insurance... catheter?... diabetes?.... walk in bathtub? Have I fallen, and I can't get up? Next stop... THE GRAVE! After being convincingly reassured that this bar was merely to provide balance while she honed her horrifying, raptor-like talons in the shower, I obliged. Mortality averted for the moment. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: C1340

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: The grab bar is pretty industrial looking. If you have ever been in a public restroom that had hand-rails, then you should be familiar with what this one looks like. The bar comes as one unit - and you get a bag of six fairly long screws to mount it with (I just used two on each end, into a wall stud). I mounted mine vertically next to the toilet - so that it's within easy reach for an elderly relative. The looks are sort of utilitarian, but for the price I'm good with that. If you want something more fancy, I would go with one of the more expensive models. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. R.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This bar is very nice also, but again I was careless in my choice. This is brushed stainless steel, the other two were smooth and shiny. That however does not take away from the usefulness and safety it gives every time I get in and out of the bath. I didn't return it because I just didn't look close enough at the picture, and it doesn't matter if it matches or not. I love the security I feel with this help.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S. Harp

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Small Grab Bar -- Great for Safety or Utility to Get Into Small Openings In Attic or Basement
customer_reviews.text: We have a basement / crawlspace that is a bit of a challenge to get in and out of. Installing these grab bars makes it easy and much safer to swing in and out of the small opening. Very sturdy when screws are sunk deep into 2x4 and 4x4 or 2x10 framing (or blocking in a wall) - full adult weight supported with no flex or creaking. This grab bars look decent and provide a good enough value to place them where needed. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Alien Bitflipper

customer_reviews.title: cheap cheap poorly made DONT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I rarely encounter as poorly made screws .It looks like they are made from pot metal Moen used to be quality. Too bad. If the quality of the screws are any indication, the grab bars are not trustworthy. I am 77 and have been doing home maintenance, even built my own cabin. These is disgustingly poorly made. I had to back the screws out with pliers because the phillips head stripped. I had even pre drilled the holes
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a Rail
customer_reviews.text: It does what it was designed to do. I installed it in my moms bathroom as she is 91 and needs support getting up and down and out of the toilet. This can be fairly easy to install if the studs are in the right place AND you have a drill, if you are using those anchors to attach it, you may need some assistance as you want to make sure it is secure if it will be supporting someone's weight. Mine works perfectly, my mom loves it!
customer_reviews.author: strix1

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I moved my 89 year old father out of his house and in with us. He had been falling in his house, and I needed to be sure he had grab bars in his room and bathroom to be safe. These have been perfect. I have one in his room, and two in the bathroom along with a vertical pole. They're very sturdy and seemed easy enough for my husband to install. I feel so much better knowing that my dad has these to hold onto while navigating through the house.
customer_reviews.author: 4noisyboys

customer_reviews.title: No more worrying about wobbling in the shower
customer_reviews.text: I have an inner ear disorder that affects my balance. I purchased this grab bar and a longer one. My friend installed them both (he said it was very easy). It's nice to have something to hold when I get wobbly in the shower, and also useful for getting out of the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Januros

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Item is very dangerous as it detached from the wall. I tried to reattached but had no luck with two units. I got hurt again as I fell on the flood and item would not attach Again. I don’t trust unit anymore, not build cottecctly. Dangerous item and so much warranty sucks. Dangerous
customer_reviews.author: Silverrose

customer_reviews.title: Find your wall-studs first and measure to get the right length.
customer_reviews.text: It has several holes under the flanges so you can always find a stud to drill into. The flanges just POP onto the back plate. Very sturdy. I made mine work, but if I bought more for another bathroom, I would use a stud finder to mark out where the studs are in the walls, then decide the angle and placement of the bar for safety, measure that length, and order the right length of bars to match.
customer_reviews.author: SheIsATabby

customer_reviews.title: Great price but this one is the thicker bar and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price but this one is the thicker bar and didn't match my other bar that was thinner in diameter. Looks very commercial like something that should be on the side of a hotel hot tub. I suggest getting the slightly thinner pipe for your bathroom. Update 8/16/2018. After having this for over a year I take back the thickness comment. Maybe I’m just used to it but this thicker one looks fine and it is well worth the money. I upgrade it to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Grab Bar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my garden tub in the master bathroom. As I get older I was feeling less comfortable getting out of the tub. I bought this and had my husband install it vertically. This is a nice and sturdy bar. It isn't going anywhere! It is easy to grab onto from the tub and no longer have any fears of slipping or falling.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie CollinsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Strong!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this grab bar in my side door hallway.when I use my crutches,going up or down the stairs.I had something to grab on.The purpose for this product, a ruptured tore hamstring in my left leg.A excellent product, was put to good use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great look, great purpose
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, can't think of how it could be any better. Looks great, great price, and easy for a good DIY guy or gal to install . . serves a great purpose to make taking a shower safer at any age. I installed two of them.
customer_reviews.author: sumhomebrew

customer_reviews.title: Happy with safety bars.
customer_reviews.text: Great safety product. Purchased this 12" bar and the 36" bar as well. Also purchased kits to attach bars through tile walls.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: good sturdy grab bar for fiberglass tub surround when installed with 'secure mount anchor' system
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I have installed into a fiberglass tub surround. I used the 'secure mount anchor' system sold separately by Moen. My only complaint is that the end caps do not snap in place when you use the secure mount system. It seems that there is not enough width to accommodate the extra thickness caused by the secure mount.
customer_reviews.author: Tanglewood

customer_reviews.title: Not textured as advertised
customer_reviews.text: After a long wait to receive this item was so disappointed that it was not as advertised - the metal is smooth not textured. Bar is very wide - too wide for my hand to grip.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Solid and attractive too
customer_reviews.text: I have recently added additional grab bars to my shower. These Moen grab bars are well made and attractive as grab bars go. They are fixed into the studs in my shower and they were professionally installed by my remodeler who was doing other work at my house at the time.
customer_reviews.author: M. O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Just beware, this thing is big!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to judge proportion in Amazon photos. I ordered this thinking it would be okay for a step up/down for a side room. It's much larger than I thought and I would not even put it in a bathroom. Maybe a garage or outdoor area, but just know that it is very large.
customer_reviews.author: Starman

customer_reviews.title: Mounting hardware junk
customer_reviews.text: The grab bar is a good value but the mounting hardware screws strip out on every use. If you buy this one will have to provide your own hardware unless you predrill every hole to the correct depth or use wall anchors, the original fasteners will not go into wood without deep pre drilling.
customer_reviews.author: rodney robbins

customer_reviews.title: Quality grab bar, doesn't comply with WA state ADA regulations
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my brother in law for a construction job he was doing. They arrived in perfect condition and looked great but when they went to install them they realized they didn't comply with Washington state ADA requlations unfortunately. They did seem to be quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: The grab bar is rock solid and quite useful.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Took a bit to figure out and identify where the studs were locations but once we marked out where the screws were going it was pretty easy. The grab bar is rock solid and quite useful.
customer_reviews.author: DesertWanderer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and clean
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after purchasing the suction cup kind and finding out they wouldn’t stick to my tile. My 71 year old mother loves them. She feels comfortable taking a shower again. I even find myself using them when shaving or cleaning between the toes! I’m really ocd about bathroom cleanliness and these being stainless steel clean easily and stay clean!
customer_reviews.author: Kinako Mochi

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Installed it on my mom's garage door. She is 81 this month. Very solid and she appreciates being able to hold on to it when entering or exiting the door.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great bar, cheap screws
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grab bar with clever mount hole system that makes it easy to get at least two screws on each end well secured into a stud. Only negative is cheap Chinese screws with easy-strip Phillips heads. My suggestion is to go to a good hardware store and spend a couple of bucks on some quality screws of the right size that won't strip so easily.
customer_reviews.author: J. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Not for the petite/small hands
customer_reviews.text: The bar itself appears to be high quality. However, be advised it does not look like the photo in the ad. The one pictured must be a long bar. The 12" bar's proportions would look much "fatter." The 1- 1/2 " diameter is very large. Too large for a petite hand.
customer_reviews.author: country girl

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy & secure
customer_reviews.text: These are a wonderful help. I am basically not ambulatory but can transfer. I just purchased 3 more, having 2 already...one more to be installed in the bathroom (2 already) and one in the kitchen and the other by my computer desk. Have one good leg and the bars give me enough stability and safety to transfer. I had them installed by a local handyman but he did not find it difficult. You may need to buy wall anchors depending on your walls and placement. I didn't so far.
customer_reviews.author: Abbey

customer_reviews.title: Moen Grab Bar
customer_reviews.text: I installed these for a neighbor who is becoming unsteady. They were easy to install and when screwed to wall studs they are extremely secure. The attached covers that hide the screws work well and give a finished appearance. I will purchase more of these if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: jopo

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is.
customer_reviews.text: It is a 12-inch Grab bar, good quality, comes with screws and some basic hardware for drywall mounting (probably needs better to be really secure). Easy installation and looks good after the covers are slid in place. No issues, as advertised, and expected.
customer_reviews.author: Will H

customer_reviews.title: Hefty & Sturdy Stainless Steel Grab Bar
customer_reviews.text: Could not find a 12-inch sturdy grab bar, stainless steel at the local home improvement stores but was able to find one on Amazon that was great in price and hefty & sturdy for installation in the shower by the side of the shower door. Am very happy with this product and am happy for the safety advantage it provides when wanting to grab a sturdy bar to stabilize oneself while getting out of the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Patty of Arcadia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tight toilet room spaces where a bit of stability is needed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for disabled client, was not able to find this 12” model in box stores or 9” version. They are a nice addition to the shower and toilet room to enable clients Independence. Solid mounting to wall studs or use Moen accessories shower mount insert assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Carl D.

customer_reviews.title: Secure enough
customer_reviews.text: Attaching to studs is required. Finding studs behind tile is challenging, then getting two screws through that stud (slightly offset because of the mounting ring) is impossible. The bar is very secure with one screw.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Timpson

customer_reviews.title: Very good bar for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Comes with stainless screws which is all I needed in this installation. I had 3/8" toggle bolts as a backup but didn't need them. Looks good and the stainless looks to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth C. Whtmore

customer_reviews.title: A well built, strong grab bar.
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a camper shower. So far, no signs of any rusting or corrosion. I sealed it well with silicone around the rings. It is so handy and makes showering so much easier in a tight space.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This item is bolted into tile. Suction does not apply here. Have tried others and the suction never holds. You will not be disappointed with this item. Strong and sturdy, just as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Look great and are very
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been asking me to put up some bars in the shower for her to hang on. I was dreading doing it not sure how they would work. Well, these came and were put up in about an hour. Look great and are very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: Moen supplied really cheap screws so we switched to "star" screws and bit. The philip heads supplied in the package stripped immediately since it is next to impossible to get a powered screwdriver directly on to the screws. Oh well, hubby got it installed finally with a lot of cuss'n and it works.
customer_reviews.author: NM Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy it works well in the bathroom were my father in law installed it for and also another one in the entryway of the garage for me to get in....very durable. I'm A big guy about 265lbs...it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Parras

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than 12" specified.
customer_reviews.text: Just a note that the flanges extend 3.25" bigger than the 12" stated. 12" is center-to-center. Be aware for tight spaces. We mounted this vertically beside a toilet to act as an additional brace for my aging parents. Affix to stud for firm mount.
customer_reviews.author: Big Man Mark

customer_reviews.title: The best made, and good for heavier persons, or someone who will put all their weight on them. mount in studs thought!!!
customer_reviews.text: SUPER DUPER STRONG. Better than other brand I bought for a little less. Please, if you have a heavier person using these, they must be built like these. The other brand is so cheap and poorly made, that you can possibly injure yourself or your loved one when they go to use it and it breaks. Worth the money, and built right (with welds). The other is screwed together and I could bend the mounting area with my fingers before installing it. SO I did not install it, and bought these
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Dufresne

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten this much sooner!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought I'd made a mistake getting a bar this thick as I have small hands. Even though it is a little wide, it's very strong and I'm very confident every time I grasp it to step out of the tub. I have balance issues and prior to this was just holding on to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosiermama

customer_reviews.title: Arrived looking used and almost rusted
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package, this thing looked used. It was almost rusted on one end of the bar. Don't waste your time or money. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bar.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Big strong and modern sleek. I installed into wall tiles with good anchors and screws. Did good pull test first. Excellent product great price.
customer_reviews.author: Seantop

customer_reviews.title: We installed and we booth use it daily
customer_reviews.text: We installed at the recommended height for handicap use. We both like it but my wife a little more so with her late stage parkinson's.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Comber

customer_reviews.title: Good product, easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem that I has was probably caused by my inattention to detail. I also ordered an 16" shower bar. Well, I did that assume thing. I assumed that all of the bars would be the same diameter. They were not.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Ridgway

customer_reviews.title: This is a great add on to any bath
customer_reviews.text: This is a great add on to any bath! Mounted to assist wife's bathing after knee replacement. Find the studs and pre drill with undersize drill and mount it. I used 1/8" then drove in the screws. Excellent quality and great price!
customer_reviews.author: Copperhead89

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: A very sturdy bar (as it should be). The well-designed mounting holes allow for considerable flexibility in attaching it to a stud. I had to drill through porcelain tile and bought Bosch ceramic tile bits at Home Depot (four different sizes for less than $10). Do not attempt to drill through this kind of tile with ordinary -- or even masonry -- bits. You can end up cracking the tile, causing immense problems.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Adams

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wood-anchor screws, stripped the heads with just a screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Expected better from Moen than screws that strip, made installation into studs a major pain because I started with screws at each end and had to buy better hardware and replace them all after drilling them out. 2 stars because it looks good, after going through the installation hassles. I will not order any Moen again.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great safety product
customer_reviews.text: Great size and easy to grip. We put one on each side of our shower to grab getting in and out. 3 weeks later I broke my hip and really needed them. And there they are. Great help. 2 screws to install.
customer_reviews.author: Ray and Kathie

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip
customer_reviews.text: Have installed three of these bars in the bathroom. No problems with any one of them. One end of one bar was not into a stud but with wall anchors it came out very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: William Dart

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality...
customer_reviews.text: but we had to return them because they were so heavy. We were taking them in suitcases to a vacation home. We replaced them with others that had a thinner circumference and were lighter. Still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Intrepid Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bar by the stairs
customer_reviews.text: Put this in the living quarters horse trailer because we need to climb up steep stairs to get to the bed. It can be dangerous, especially when getting down at night. The bar is wonderful and just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: readergirl

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would save myself some money and order ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would save myself some money and order "an open box" item that promised to be new, the safety bar I ordered had a big dent in it and there was no hardware in the box to put it up with.. Never again, it's not worth the aggravation and time, especially after spending 36 days in the hospital and needing the safety bars when you come home..
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kris

customer_reviews.title: Makes getting into tub/shower much safer
customer_reviews.text: Makes getting into tub/shower much safer. Pretty easy to install - takes some muscle for the screws. VERY sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: It looks like brushed nickel and not chrome
customer_reviews.text: If you are doing your bathroom in chorme, which is what this SAYS it is - do not buy it. It looks like brushed nickel and not chrome.
customer_reviews.author: rusty

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy hand grab.
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar is short but perfect for our backdoor to the garage that has a step down. It is thick, just right for a good hand grab. Easy to install and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Besly

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for steps in garage
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a hip replaced and needed something to help with a few steps in our garage. This bar has worked well as we don’t have a railing
customer_reviews.author: kab

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Good solid quality.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this beside my 83 y/o Dad’s bathtub after he had a scary fall. Now he has a dependable handle to help him out. Install was very easy as well and solid quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly and yes I had a handyman install on tile. The suction cup type did not work on my 4x4 tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Geo Oahu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent handicap bars
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality handicap bars we used three of them in our shower and a couple around the house very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Gr8

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and look nice.
customer_reviews.text: Since this bar is made to screw in to secure, there is no suction. Found that it was better to hand screw into wall to prevent stripping the screw heads. Very sturdy and look nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Charta F

customer_reviews.title: Decent bar, but consider the hand size (grasp) of the person who might need it.
customer_reviews.text: If installed correctly, ffers good support for leaning on. I think the diameter is a bit too large for an elderly woman or children to be able to grasp it securely. And in a bath or shower, these is the added risk of the metal being smooth and slippery when wet.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Logan

customer_reviews.title: holds my weight amazingly well!
customer_reviews.text: screwed the brackets into studs in the wall and it works perfectly outside the tub! never used the suction parts.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L

customer_reviews.title: Feel secure with this type of bar.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a suction type. You attach it with screws. I already have the large one up and am looking forward to my son putting this one up for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grab bar in a hard to find size.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and robust 1 1/2" diameter grab bar at a very good price. I find this size perfect for entering/exiting a shower or bathtub assisting with stepping over the rim or sill. Moen may make lousy faucets, but their grab bars are top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Skwow

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar was installed during bathroom remodeling so is screwed onto the studs. I don’t know why it says suction power on the review stars section!?
customer_reviews.author: Grandma95

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality. I own several.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Heavy-duty, just the right size. I have others, but the 18". This one - the 12-inch - is perfect for my exit to my garage where we need a shorter handle to step down.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Minuth

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy And Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar is well made and mounts sturdily to the wood-backed shower wall I have. Without a solid wall, you'll need to mount this to the studs in the wall to assure a safe installation, per the manufacturer's instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Brown123

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Well made. I weigh over 300 lbs and it is rock solid when I pull on it.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Nice item.  Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Received as ordered. Installed for mother in law. Very good quality and good value.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Phy

customer_reviews.title: GOOD  - BUT THROW AWAY THE MOUNTING SCREWS
customer_reviews.text: The grab bar itself is very good, but the mounting screws are cheap "Chinesium" metal that strip and will cause you frustration. Throw away the screws that come with it, use your own, and you will have a much better experience! If it had good screws I would have given it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver with getting out of shower and price was great. Unfortunately I was not able to install so had to pay for installation, which in the long run is certainly worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Christine L

customer_reviews.title: grab bar
customer_reviews.text: Was attached by screws supplied If it was battery operated light it could be a night light. It wasn't
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L Clark

customer_reviews.title: Grab bar
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install Feels well made Perfect size for the place we installed My mother use the shower and avoid a fall grabbing to this bar So what more can I ask
customer_reviews.author: Melmac

customer_reviews.title: nice looking
customer_reviews.text: This was attached to the wall with screws & is very effective as a hand hold..
customer_reviews.author: asrielsmom

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy support, fairly easy to install. Looks good not perfect but a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Kentm

customer_reviews.title: strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: perfect fitment. strong and durable. the ends just pop-on with no problem. and the package comes with big screws. this is a really good price too!
customer_reviews.author: FetvusForTheRestuvus

customer_reviews.title: Safety grip
customer_reviews.text: Necessary grip for the RV shower. Like the brushed nickel look. Finding a stud in the wall is critical to the mounting.
customer_reviews.author: TerryBea

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my parents to install in the shower & it works great :)
customer_reviews.author: Bigred6476

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: It was fast and easy to install that is going to be used for one step into house. My wife is happy for the added support since she is having cancer treatment, and gets unsteady at times.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: a needed measure of safety
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this beauty on the wall of the tub so it can be grasped as a person enters or exits. It is a natural move to grab it and now adds a measure of safety that was long missing. Very substantial unit, easy to install. Cannot imagine a bath without such a thing since a fall in that spot could severely hurt just about any person.
customer_reviews.author: James451

customer_reviews.title: Commercial quality
customer_reviews.text: My best review would be I buying two more of these bars, sturdy and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Hound

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It’s a metal pipe... What more can I say. Comes as described, fits as expected. I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: 12 inches short and strong and durable and grab-enabled bathroom hand rail
customer_reviews.text: It is made in China, but it entails the USA quality, and it is a good design, with 2 gorgeously welded ends to support the whole shaft, and the whole shaft is strong and durable and grab-enabled, but it requires hammer drilling installation work to fix it firmly.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy product. Very helpfull for someone disabled. Just make sure you screw it into a stud. Use stud finder if available.
customer_reviews.author: Hal R

customer_reviews.title: Mounts are secure
customer_reviews.text: They arrived on time, better then what I expected.Thick for my big hands to grab, sturdy mount. Feel secure when I grab a hold of them to life myself up. Yes I will recommend this product to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Stable with good look for showers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, got these for my mother to help her. They look really nice. Very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The real thing
customer_reviews.text: Good looking. Sturdy. Has lots of mounting holes for a range of stud spacings.
customer_reviews.author: Blackhorse

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to place and works well, got this for my mom to help get in and out of the tub and this does the job
customer_reviews.author: Terra V.

customer_reviews.title: The mounting hole pattern is a little weird -- took ...
customer_reviews.text: The mounting hole pattern is a little weird -- took some thought to figure how to get two screws top and bottom securely fastened into the stud. Works very well once installed properly.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a handle for a homemade boombox (picture of mock fit). Uses three large screws on either side and seems like it should hold well for my use for sure, hard to really speak if its used for a grab handle in a shower, but if mounted to studs it seems solid enough to bear a fair bit of weight from a person as well. Very aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal
customer_reviews.text: I love the cost and quality of these hand grabs.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hedin

customer_reviews.title: Well made product at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy. I am much more comfortable going up and down the step up to our kitchen when I have my hand on this grab bar. Will probably buy longer ones for the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This was a difficult size to find but just what we were looking for as a grab bar when leaving the shower or getting up from the toilet - perfect for someone with a balance problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gamegram

customer_reviews.title: Good handle, but very cheap and weak screws.
customer_reviews.text: Grab bar is good quality, but the screws are very cheap and weak. Stripped 3 out of 6 screws while mounting them into the stud. I expected better from Moen. I had to use my own quality screws. If you do buy this, I suggest getting your own quality screws.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

product_meta.title: Moen 8912 Home 12-Inch Bathroom Grab Bar, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description:
Size:12 InchEnjoy a stable handhold and help maintain your balance with the Moen 12-Inch Grab Bar. Designed to provide greater peace of mind in the bathroom, this 12-inch grab bar supports up to 500 pounds and provides added safety whether you're showering, bathing, or using the toilet. The SecureMount design allows for easy, secure installation at any angle and helps ensure proper alignment. With its durable stainless steel construction and corrosion-resistant finish, this bath grip delivers lasting performance and has a sleek look that complements a variety of décors. From the Manufacturer Moen SecureMount Stainless 12-Inch grab bar delivers a lightly brushed warm grey metallic look. It is ADA compliant and comes with a limited lifetime warranty. A Genuine Moen Product. Moen is dedicated to designing and delivering beautiful products that last a lifetime. Moen offers a diverse selection of kitchen faucets, kitchen sinks, bathroom faucets and accessories, and showering products. Moen products combine style and functionality with durability for a lifetime of customer satisfaction.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Moen SecureMount Stainless 12-Inch grab bar delivers a lightly brushed warm grey metallic look. It is ADA compliant and comes with a limited lifetime warranty. A Genuine Moen Product. Moen is dedicated to designing and delivering beautiful products that last a lifetime. Moen offers a diverse selection of kitchen faucets, kitchen sinks, bathroom faucets and accessories, and showering products. Moen products combine style and functionality with durability for a lifetime of customer satisfaction.
